result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan Jose MARTINEZ-GALICIA was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Cocaine, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Possess Cocaine, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Possess Cocaine, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Manitowoc County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: on each count, to run concurrent to each other.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

timeConds.notes: under the Huber Law.  Sixty (60) days to be served up front and thirty (30) days to be stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the Court.
